item.title: Milwaukee Assessment
item.description: I had the opportunity to research the City of Milwaukee’s housing market. The Assessor’s Office of Milwaukee provided the data. The research goals provided by the office were: Identifying how market trends differentially impact communities of color and varying socioeconomic status; and Determining whether Milwaukee property assessments change disproportionately according to demographic factors. The data was 8500 home sales from 2018 to 2019, which included 60 house characteristics, e.

item.title: Variable Effect Curve
item.description: Prediction is cool, useful, and good. I, for some reason, am not impressed by it, especially with continuous outcomes. Every time I fit a Deep NN, XGBoost, LASSO, Random Forest, etc. I am left empty. My MSE is incredibly low. Hurray. Why is this the case? What variables are important? To what degree is each imput important? I understand the different goals of inference & prediction, but these methods are so powerful; they must be holding important information!
